dtliExcerpt: In any case, “Once Upon a One More Time” is a dizzy but enjoyable goof, similar in many ways to “& Juliet.”
showScoreExcerpt: “The musical’s primary assets are its splendid cast and the silly smartness of the integration of song and story. Which brings to mind the splendid, silly and smart performance of Jennifer Simard in the role of Cinderella’s stepmother...Ms. Simard, is one of Broadway’s unsung, or undersung, treasures, and her performance alone brings sufficient pleasure to make this trip to Britney-land worth a visit.”

keyPhrases.quote: The show finds its groove when it stops trying so hard to be clever
creating moments of genuine emotional connection amid the fairy-tale chaos

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The critic describes the show as 'enjoyable' with 'genuine emotional connection' while acknowledging it's a 'goof' that sometimes tries too hard, suggesting a qualified but positive recommendation. | GPT-4o-mini: The review expresses a clear positive sentiment towards the show, highlighting enjoyable moments and emotional connections despite some reservations about its cleverness.

garbageFullText: The show finds its groove when it stops trying so hard to be clever and lets the pop anthems do their work, creating moments of genuine emotional connection amid the fairy-tale chaos.
